author: Anuja Puranik
text: "Amazing waterfront with NYC skyline views. The waterfront connects Newport
column6: Hoboken all the way to Secaucus.  There are many restaurants
column7: cafes on the street and it's very lovely especially in summer and fall. There are couple of restaurants which have great views while dining.  Try to come here to catch early morning sunrise or at golden hour for sunset. The views are surreal!!"

author: Marcio Risso
text: "Really amazing New York Skyline view. The are a lot of restaurants and cafes nearby
column5: incluing the world's famous Carlos Bakery. It's deeply recommended to grab a coffee and come to the waterfront and enjoy the view while drinking it."

author: Gehendra Karmacharya
text: 'Amazing new york skyline . Love the view.'

author: Satish Wadde
text: 'Nice view of NY we can catch from here!'

author: Nisar Naziri
text: 'This 1 star review is specifically for the municipality and the police. There is limited parking space or no parking space at all. In case you find a parking by the side of the road
column5: you will be given a parking ticket even if you park at the middle of the night.'

author: Kellie Z
text: 'I would like to thank TLC for producing a show about a little bakery in Hoboken and I would like to thank Buddy and his beautiful family for having this cute little bakery and making  a show on TLC about it.  If it had not been for TLC
column7: we would not have visited Hoboken during our week long visit to NYC.  We are in love with Hoboken.  We want to move to Hoboken. We are world travelers
column8: seriously we have been all over the world
column9: well we haven’t been to Africa or South America YET.  But anyway
column10: Hoboken ranks up there with our favorite cities in the World.  Washington St should be in Guinness’s World Record for having the most people under 30 on their streets at any given time. The cutest dogs on leashes
column11: on the street at any given time
column12: and the most golden doodles at sidewalk cafes
column13: at any given time.  Seriously.  I understand why there are so many real estate offices on Washington Street (Oh!Another Guinness record!). If any of those offices had been open last night
column14: we would have immediately signed on the dotted line for any available apartment.  Never mind that rental for a loft is the same as the mortgage on my  5 bedroom
column15: three bath house eight hours away.  Can you really put a price tag on a piece of heaven on earth? Anyway
column16: This trip is about revisiting NYC
column17: but we just want to hang out on Washington St in Hoboken and eat at every single adorable and chic restaurant
column18: cafe and bakery and just watch all of the cool
column19: beautiful people and adorable dogs who are blessed to be in the greatest little city that no one outside of this corner of heaven would know about if it weren’t for the cute little bakery across from the very large Hoboken City Hall that was somehow featured on a network watched the world over.  God bless Hoboken and everyone there.  We ♥️ you!'
